Helpers

These classes can be used to alter general elements on the webpage, but are not required.

Backgrounds Colors

Here is the Meta-UI background color pallete.

  
    <div class="bg--grey-clear"></div>
    <div class="bg--grey-dark"></div>
    <div class="bg--red"></div>
    <div class="bg--blue"></div>
    <div class="bg--yellow"></div>
    <div class="bg--teal"></div>
    <div class="bg--blue-dark"></div>

Type Colors

Here is the Meta-UI type color pallete. These can be used to change the color of the typography.

  
    <div class="type--grey"></div>
    <div class="type--grey-dark"></div>
    <div class="type--grey-darker"></div>
    <div class="type--red"></div>
    <div class="type--blue"></div>
    <div class="type--yellow"></div>
    <div class="type--teal"></div>
    <div class="type--blue-dark"></div>
    <div class="type--white"></div>

Floats & Positioning

pull-left positions the element to the very left. pull-right positions the element to the very right.

  
  <div class="bg--grey-clear pull-left"></div>
  <div class="bg--blue pull-left"></div>
  <div class="bg--red pull-right"></div>
  <div class="bg--yellow pull-right"></div>

Clearfix

The clearfix class clears floats when it is added to the parent element. This can also be used as a mixin by adding @include clearfix to the CSS class.

In this example, the clearfix class allows the border to span around the boxes.

  
  <div class="clearfix--border clearfix">
    <div class="bg--grey-clear pull-left"></div>
    <div class="bg--red pull-right"></div>
  </div>
